cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to each service instance.

mem.description: Memory to allocate to each service instance.

placement.description: Constraints control where apps run to allow optimizing for either fault tolerance (by spreading a task out on multiple nodes) or locality (by running all of an applications tasks on the same node).

constraints.description: Constraints have three parts: a field name, an operator, and an optional parameter. The field can be the hostname of the agent node or any attribute of the agent node. Example: [["rack_id", "LIKE", "rack-foo-.*"], ["rack_id", "MAX_PER", "2"]]

region.description: All application nodes will run in this region. When no region is specified the nodes are constrained to the local region.

local_backup_volume.description: Local volumes configuration (only used if external persistent volumes are disabled). Please read Pre-Install Notes for setup for local volumes.

host_path.description: The location of a volume on the host to be used for persisting your service configuration and data.

local_data_volume.description: Local volumes configuration (only used if external persistent volumes are disabled). Please read Pre-Install Notes for setup for local volumes.

host_path.description: The location of a volume on the host to be used for persisting your service configuration and data.

local_logs_volume.description: Local volumes configuration (only used if external persistent volumes are disabled). Please read Pre-Install Notes for setup for local volumes.

host_path.description: The location of a volume on the host to be used for persisting your service configuration and data.

local_temp_db_volume.description: Local volumes configuration (only used if external persistent volumes are disabled). Please read Pre-Install Notes for setup for local volumes.

host_path.description: The location of a volume on the host to be used for persisting your service configuration and data.

port.description: Port number to be used for clear communication internally to the cluster. Currently unused and fixed to be 3306.

host_mode.description: Enable or disable host networking mode. NOTE: this requires the default port to be available on the target host. This also forces to have a single instance per node.

external_access.description:
Enable access from outside the cluster through Marathon-LB.
NOTE: this connection is unencrypted.

enable.description: Enable or disable creating a VIP for external access through a public node running Marathon-LB.

external_access_port.description: For external access, port number to be used for clear communication in the external Marathon-LB load balancer

SA_PASSWORD.description: Give the name of the corresponding secret in the secret store. A_PASSWORD is the database system administrator (userid = 'sa') password used to connect to SQL Server once the container is running. Important note: This password needs to include at least 8 characters of at least three of these four categories: uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers and non-alphanumeric symbols.

MSSQL_PID.description: MSSQL_PID is the Product ID (PID) or Edition that the container will run with.

MSSQL_LCID.description: Sets the language ID to use for SQL Server.Default value is English ; for example 1036 is French. To se all options, visit the https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/relational-databases/system-catalog-views/sys-fulltext-languages-transact-sql?view=sql-server-2017

MSSQL_BACKUP_DIR.description: Set the Default backup directory location.

MSSQL_LOG_DIR.description: Change the directory where the new SQL Server database log (.ldf) files are created.

MSSQL_DUMP_DIR.description: Change the directory where SQL Server will deposit the memory dumps and other troubleshooting files by default.

MSSQL_DATA_DIR.description: Change the directory where the new SQL Server database data files (.mdf) are created.
